db:abstract.db:para: The QSqlField class manipulates the fields in SQL database tables and views.

db:listitem.db:para: QSqlField is part of Database Classesshared

db:section.db:title: Detailed Description
db:section.db:para: QSqlField represents the characteristics of a single column in a database table or view, such as the data type and column name. A field also contains the value of the database column, which can be viewed or changed.
Field data values are stored as QVariants. Using an incompatible type is not permitted. For example:
However, the field will attempt to cast certain data types to the field data type where possible:
db:section.db:programlisting: QSqlField field("age", QMetaType::fromType<int>()); field.setValue(QString("123")); // casts QString to int
db:section.db:para: QSqlField objects are rarely created explicitly in application code. They are usually accessed indirectly through QSqlRecords that already contain a list of fields. For example:

A QSqlField object can provide some meta-data about the field, for example, its name(), variant type(), length(), precision(), defaultValue(), typeID(), and its requiredStatus(), isGenerated() and isReadOnly(). The field's data can be checked to see if it isNull(), and its value() retrieved. When editing the data can be set with setValue() or set to NULL with clear().

db:section.db:title: enum QSqlField::RequiredStatus
db:section.db:para: Specifies whether the field is required or optional.

db:td.db:para: The field must be specified when inserting records.
The fields doesn't have to be specified when inserting records.
The database driver couldn't determine whether the field is required or optional.

db:section.db:title: [explicit, since 6.0] QSqlField::QSqlField(const QString &fieldName = QString(), QMetaType type = QMetaType(), const QString &table = QString())

db:constructorsynopsis.db:synopsisinfo: QSqlField(const QString &fieldName, QMetaType type, const QString &table)

db:section.db:para: This is an overloaded function.
Constructs an empty field called fieldName of type type in table.
This function was introduced in Qt 6.0.

db:section.db:title: QSqlField::QSqlField(const QSqlField &other)
db:section.db:para: Constructs a copy of other.

db:section.db:title: QSqlField::~QSqlField()
db:section.db:para: Destroys the object and frees any allocated resources.

db:section.db:title: void QSqlField::clear()
db:section.db:para: Clears the value of the field and sets it to NULL. If the field is read-only, nothing happens.

db:section.db:title: QVariant QSqlField::defaultValue() const
db:section.db:para: Returns the field's default value (which may be NULL).

db:section.db:title: bool QSqlField::isAutoValue() const
db:section.db:para: Returns true if the value is auto-generated by the database, for example auto-increment primary key values.

db:note.db:para: When using the ODBC driver, due to limitations in the ODBC API, the isAutoValue() field is only populated in a QSqlField resulting from a QSqlRecord obtained by executing a SELECT query. It is false in a QSqlField resulting from a QSqlRecord returned from QSqlDatabase::record() or QSqlDatabase::primaryIndex().

db:section.db:title: bool QSqlField::isGenerated() const
db:section.db:para: Returns true if the field is generated; otherwise returns false.

db:section.db:title: bool QSqlField::isNull() const
db:section.db:para: Returns true if the field's value is NULL; otherwise returns false.

db:section.db:title: bool QSqlField::isReadOnly() const
db:section.db:para: Returns true if the field's value is read-only; otherwise returns false.

db:section.db:title: bool QSqlField::isValid() const
db:section.db:para: Returns true if the field's variant type is valid; otherwise returns false.

db:section.db:title: int QSqlField::length() const
db:section.db:para: Returns the field's length.
If the returned value is negative, it means that the information is not available from the database.

db:section.db:title: QMetaType QSqlField::metaType() const
db:section.db:para: Returns the field's type as stored in the database. Note that the actual value might have a different type, Numerical values that are too large to store in a long int or double are usually stored as strings to prevent precision loss.

db:section.db:title: QString QSqlField::name() const
db:section.db:para: Returns the name of the field.

db:section.db:title: int QSqlField::precision() const
db:section.db:para: Returns the field's precision; this is only meaningful for numeric types.
If the returned value is negative, it means that the information is not available from the database.

db:section.db:title: QSqlField::RequiredStatus QSqlField::requiredStatus() const
db:section.db:para: Returns true if this is a required field; otherwise returns false. An INSERT will fail if a required field does not have a value.

db:section.db:title: void QSqlField::setAutoValue(bool autoVal)
db:section.db:para: Marks the field as an auto-generated value if autoVal is true.

db:section.db:title: void QSqlField::setDefaultValue(const QVariant &value)
db:section.db:para: Sets the default value used for this field to value.

db:section.db:title: void QSqlField::setGenerated(bool gen)
db:section.db:para: Sets the generated state. If gen is false, no SQL will be generated for this field; otherwise, Qt classes such as QSqlQueryModel and QSqlTableModel will generate SQL for this field.

db:section.db:title: void QSqlField::setLength(int fieldLength)
db:section.db:para: Sets the field's length to fieldLength. For strings this is the maximum number of characters the string can hold; the meaning varies for other types.

db:section.db:title: void QSqlField::setMetaType(QMetaType type)
db:section.db:para: Set's the field's variant type to type.

db:section.db:title: void QSqlField::setName(const QString &name)
db:section.db:para: Sets the name of the field to name.

db:section.db:title: void QSqlField::setPrecision(int precision)
db:section.db:para: Sets the field's precision. This only affects numeric fields.

db:section.db:title: void QSqlField::setReadOnly(bool readOnly)
db:section.db:para: Sets the read only flag of the field's value to readOnly. A read-only field cannot have its value set with setValue() and cannot be cleared to NULL with clear().

db:section.db:title: void QSqlField::setRequired(bool required)
db:section.db:para: Sets the required status of this field to Required if required is true; otherwise sets it to Optional.

db:section.db:title: void QSqlField::setRequiredStatus(QSqlField::RequiredStatus required)
db:section.db:para: Sets the required status of this field to required.

db:section.db:title: void QSqlField::setTableName(const QString &table)
db:section.db:para: Sets the tableName of the field to table.

db:section.db:title: void QSqlField::setValue(const QVariant &value)
db:section.db:para: Sets the value of the field to value. If the field is read-only (isReadOnly() returns true), nothing happens.

If the data type of value differs from the field's current data type, an attempt is made to cast it to the proper type. This preserves the data type of the field in the case of assignment, e.g. a QString to an integer data type.
To set the value to NULL, use clear().

db:section.db:title: [since 6.6] void QSqlField::swap(QSqlField &other)
db:section.db:para: Swaps this field with other. This function is very fast and never fails.
This function was introduced in Qt 6.6.

db:section.db:title: QString QSqlField::tableName() const
db:section.db:para: Returns the tableName of the field.

db:note.db:para: When using the QPSQL driver, due to limitations in the libpq library, the tableName() field is not populated in a QSqlField resulting from a QSqlRecord obtained by QSqlQuery::record() of a forward-only query.

db:section.db:title: QVariant QSqlField::value() const
db:section.db:para: Returns the value of the field as a QVariant.
Use isNull() to check if the field's value is NULL.

db:section.db:title: bool QSqlField::operator!=(const QSqlField &other) const
db:section.db:para: Returns true if the field is unequal to other; otherwise returns false.

db:section.db:title: QSqlField &QSqlField::operator=(const QSqlField &other)
db:section.db:para: Sets the field equal to other.

db:section.db:title: bool QSqlField::operator==(const QSqlField &other) const
db:section.db:para: Returns true if the field is equal to other; otherwise returns false.

db:section.db:title: Obsolete Members for QSqlField
db:section.db:para: The following members of class QSqlField are deprecated. We strongly advise against using them in new code.

db:section.db:title: QSqlField::QSqlField(const QString &fieldName, QVariant::Type type, const QString &table = QString())

db:constructorsynopsis.db:synopsisinfo: QSqlField(const QString &fieldName, QVariant::Type type, const QString &table)

db:section.db:para: This function is deprecated since 6.0. We strongly advise against using it in new code.
Use the constructor taking a QMetaType instead.
This is an overloaded function.
Constructs an empty field called fieldName of variant type type in table.

db:section.db:title: void QSqlField::setType(QVariant::Type type)
db:section.db:para: This function is deprecated since 6.0. We strongly advise against using it in new code.
Use setMetaType() instead.
Sets the field's variant type to type.

db:section.db:title: QVariant::Type QSqlField::type() const
db:section.db:para: This function is deprecated since 6.0. We strongly advise against using it in new code.
Use metaType() instead.

Returns the field's type as stored in the database. Note that the actual value might have a different type, Numerical values that are too large to store in a long int or double are usually stored as strings to prevent precision loss.
